main event: A circular, green object was observed by air traffic controllers at Mather Air Force Base, California on January 2, 1966.
interesting points: The object had a tail approximately 8-25 feet long with the same green color as the object.
The object was descending at a 15-degree angle from the vertical before it disappeared, appearing to float and disintegrate before hitting the ground.
The object did not make any maneuvers and disappeared just prior to hitting the ground.
The base operations officer believed the object was most likely a meteorite.
sighted object: circular, green object with a tail
witnesses: two air traffic controllers, Joseph A. Schulze and John W. Paxton, Jr.
